From the manufacturer

4K UHD IPS

The clarity and details with 4K Ultra HD resolution will amaze, even up close. With over 99% coverage of the sRGB spectrum this LG monitor is a great solution for professional photographers, graphic designers or anyone looking for highly accurate color.

View larger
Read more

On-Screen Control

On-Screen Control puts a host of essential monitor settings into a handy window for quick, easy access. Volume, brightness, picture mode presets, Screen Split 2.0 and Dual Controller and more can now be adjusted with just a few clicks of the mouse, instead of hard buttons on the monitor.

View larger
Read more

Features


View larger


View larger


View larger

Screen Split 2.0

Customize your monitor layout for multitasking with the latest version of LG Screen Split. Resize and display multiple windows at once, with 14 options including four different picture-in-picture (PIP) choices.

4K UHD Gaming

Game On! The clarity and fine details of 4K UHD will amaze gamers thanks to 8.3 million pixels on a screen with resolution of 3840 x 2160. That's four times the resolution of Full HD for an even more immersive gaming experience.

FreeSync

With FreeSync, gamers can experience seamless, fluid movement throughout hi-res, fast-paced games. FreeSync eliminates tearing and stuttering that can occur because of differences between a graphic cards frame rate and a monitors refresh rate.

Read more

Additional Features


View larger


View larger


View larger

Game Mode

Set Game Mode for optimal gaming conditions. There are 3 modes, 2 First-Person-Shooter modes and a RTS pre-set mode so you can choose the best mode for your games.

Advanced Gaming Features

Serious gaming features for serious gamers. Quickly optimize monitor settings to activate Black Stabilizer to reveal superior detail in dark scenes while the Dynamic Action Sync feature assures smooth, fluid gaming action.

Arcline Design

The sleek design of LG premium monitors is accentuated by the new ArcLine stand. The smooth curve of the base provides stability, assuring dependable performance with a touch of elegance.

Product description

Color:27-Inch 4K UHD IPS Monitor

The LG 27UD68 4K UHD monitor must been seen to be believed. Whether watching movies, playing games or just reading from your screen, the 4K UHD display provides stunning images at four times the resolution of standard full HD. But it's how the 4K UHD is used that's most impressive. For creative professionals, the RGB over 99% color accuracy is ideal for turning creative visions into reality on the desktop. The 27UD68 works hard, but plays hard too. With a host of gamer-friendly features such as free sync, Black stabilizer, dynamic action sync and game mode, smoother, stutter-free gaming has never looked as glorious as it does in 4K UHD.

mike
5.0 out of 5 stars4K + Gorgeous Colors
January 14, 2018
Color: 27-Inch 4K UHD IPS MonitorVerified Purchase
Ok so first off, I bought this to use as a display for my PS4 Pro at college so thats my primary use for it.

Cons-
Lightbleeding (common for IPS tho)
Minimal audio outputs

Pros+
Thin Bezel
Great Viewing Angles
Vibrant/Accurate Colors
CRISP 4K Quality
Smooth 60fps and Response Time
Ease of Setup

*READ*
Ok so something you should know when gaming with a PS4 Pro with this monitor, the monitor obviously doesnt support HDR, however, it DOES allow the PS4 to use the Deep Color Output feature in the PS4 screen options! This is very rare for a monitor or TV to support and it does add detail to the colors and takes advantage of the advanced
99%+RGB color range (of course non-HDR) of the monitor.

Also, yes, this monitor allows Netflix, Amazon, Vudu, Apple TV, etc to stream at native 4K on capable streaming devices. Hope this review helps!

Brian coe
5.0 out of 5 starsSeems like a beautiful crisp picture, some caveats, absolutely the best value
November 14, 2017
Color: 27-Inch 4K UHD IPS MonitorVerified Purchase
Seems like a beautiful crisp picture.

FOR XBOX ONE S users: In order to get the xbox to play Blu-Ray in 4k. You need to go into the Monitor settings under:

INPUT, Make Aspect Ratio ORIGINAL
Under FreeSync make it Extended or basic...
Also set the mode to game mode:dark

CONFIRM it is in 4k by:
1. play a video
2. press the Xbox button twice
3. Goto settings / Video & Audio
4. Go into the Video settings
5. If it says 4k, you are in 4k... If it says 1080p something is wrong.

FOR COMPUTER USERS:
Use game mode: for reduced latency

If you are using an nvidia card, make sure the freesync option is set to: off

3.0 out of 5 starsThe screen is absolutely beautiful and has immense value for money
May 23, 2018
Color: 27-Inch 4K UHD IPS MonitorVerified Purchase
The screen is absolutely beautiful and has immense value for money. The only issue with the 68-W version is that the "base" of the monitor is very flimsy. The product description on the listing page is inaccurate as it does not mention that and the images also do not reveal the same. There is no height adjustment available in this version. I returned my monitor because of the flimsy stand. It used to make the screen wobble if I were using my keyboard while typing. There is another version of this monitor , the 68-P version. That one has the correct stand. Please consider that if you want a proper experience.

Roberto Jorge
5.0 out of 5 starsBest 4K UHD Monitor for 2016 under 500?
April 27, 2016
Color: 27-Inch 4K UHD IPS Monitor
 So is the LG 27UD68-W the Best 4K UHD Monitor for 2016 under 500 ?

What i can say about this UHD display is that its beautifully designed, edge to edge panel with a silver frame all around and a white back and a aggressive curved stand. I really liked the awesome look of the LG 27UD68-W, that shows class.

It is a IPS panel with a maximum resolution of 3840x2160 a response time of 5ms with a refresh rate of 60hrz

In terms of connections it has 2x HDMI 2.0, 1x Display Port 1.4, 1x Audio Jack, 1x Power Input Jack and a Kensington lock.

My review and tests had the following steps:
- Unboxing
- Setup
- Viewing Angles (dark enviroment / light enviroment)
- Colors / Contrast
- UHD Pictures Slidehow (dark enviroment / light enviroment)
- Movie Samples UHD (dark enviroment / light enviroment)
- Light Bleeding Test
- Shadows Test
- After Effects / Video Editing (timeline, resolution)
- Gaming (Freesync / Screen Tearing)

All in all was a great experience and this year i will be upgrading my Triple Monitor Setup and these LG27UD68-W are sure on my list.

Things i did like the Most:
- Beautiful Design and Overall Looks
- Nice Colors and Contrast
- Joystick for the OSD Functions
- Vesa Mount that Allow us to Use any Stand
- Finally the Price Point that makes this Monitor a Deal to Have in Consideration

Things i Did Like the Least:
- Lack of Adjustments on the Stand
- Extreme Angles with Glare (Refection)

Amy B
4.0 out of 5 starsMonitor is great, stand is super cheap plastic.
November 7, 2017
Color: 27-Inch 4K UHD IPS MonitorVerified Purchase
The monitor itself is fantastic. The cheap-o plastic base that comes with it is pretty much garbage, though. Plan on buying a proper monitor stand to go with this!

I use this with my new 13" MacBook Pro and the colors are amazing. I was on the lookout for a 4k monitor, after having gotten used to sitting at a big old Apple Cinema Display. They don't make those anymore, so I began the hunt. This is by far the best rated 4k monitor for the price, hands down. The colors are fantastic, I have zero bleeding or display issues at all. The menus are easy to access and manipulate, which is always a plus. The tiny bezels are what really pushed this monitor over the competition for me. I sit with with my desk facing a window so I can enjoy the sunshine and I really like that the the bezels are really small, minimizing the amount of blocked view to my window.

The stand the monitor comes with is probably the only negative thing about it. I have it sitting on a standing desk, which means there's a little bit more movement to the desk then normal, and it's enough to cause the whole monitor to constantly wobble while I'm typing. There are decent, well-made monitor stands available for pretty cheap, though, so I wouldn't let that stop you from buying this!

Pros:
IPS with 10 bit color, great for photo editing.
4K, but still large enough to not need text scaling (If you have fairly good vision, I'd say about 30/20 or better). It's like having 4 1080p monitors setup together.
Very attractive stand and back, if you care about that.

Cons:
While the stand looks nice, it's a little wobbly if you're a fast and furious typist like I am. Also no height adjustment.
The inline power brick is a bit annoying. I wish it were inside the monitor itself. Too many monitors today do this.
